content.description: on first terrace continue up left

I liked the first bolt on pitch two, it protects groundfall potential on a ramp and the 3rd bolt is on great rock for clipping.  Right after that it gets steep and cruxy.  Well bolted and on great rock, it is one of the best I have been on in camelback.   

  It is next to  one of the scariest routes on camelback, The Icebox 5.8x.  It actually shares one of the bolts up high.  The Icebox is the dihedral, very soft rock, just to this route's left.
content.protection: 12 quickdraws/runners, ss glue-in bolts and anchors.
content.location: Walk to the end of the Headwall and begin on the white granite just right of the dihedral/gully.  P1 has 2 bolts, p2 has 12 bolts, p3 has 3 (?).  Rap the route with single 60m rope.  If you rap from the top, the first rap is a short one to the top of the 2nd pitch.  Watch the ends at the second/longest rap.
Just 75' left of Donamatrix around buttress.

content.description: Climb a recessed gully with hard-to-find pro to a ledge.  Most approach this route as a solo to the upper terrace.
content.protection: Not much to be found.  Rappel off eyebolt below a large boulder.
content.location: Recessed gully to the right of only bolted route.

content.description: The safest way to access the upper terrace.
content.location: Bolted route to the right of a recessed gully and to the left of a small tree.

content.description: Somewhat overhung throughout most of the climb.  IMO, the crux is the first few moves off the ground.  Lots of loose rock outside of the bolt line.
content.location: Near the end of the Headwall, and approx 30' to the left of Cameltoe.

content.description:
This scramble is a great adventure that takes you into the mouth of August Canyon. The rock is for the most part solid granite, but be careful of loose gravel over the surface on ledges. It is the definition of fourth class, and quickly gains great exposure over the north face of the head.  

  Start up low angle fourth class from the western end of the headwall, about 100' right of the dihedral that Spicebox climbs. It's a pick-your-own-adventure style route, so go up whatever looks good and aim for a large ledge about 80' up. At this point, start traversing right. Somewhere in here is the first of several old bolts on the route. There are just enough to let you know you're on route. Keep traversing right, gaining no elevation. When you come to a bolt with ring and second nearby bolt, traverse down and right (do not be lured into going up) around a corner. At this point you should see cairns built on a boulder in a small amphitheater type formation. Keep following the easiest line up and right into August Canyon. 

  Overall a super fun scramble on (mostly) good rock.
content.protection: None. There are about 4 rusty 1.5'' drop in bolts with Leeper hangers, so there's no pro. No real options for anchors of any type. Fourth class. Solo it.
content.location: Route starts about 100' right of the dihedral at the western end of the Headwall, then traverses right and over the Sacred Grotto Cave up into August Canyon. I highly recommend looking at the route from the parking lot; look for what looks like fourth class. It's all low angle, and looking from a distance will help with route finding.

content.description: Start approximately 100ft. to the right of The George route. If you like The George route this is a fun alternate start. Scramble up 10-15 Ft. to granite ledge to belay. Then follow nine bolts to two bolt anchor with chains. A two foot runner on the third bolt will reduce rope drag. It is possible to rappel however due to rope drag toperoping isn't recommended. General Camelback Caution should be used and helmets recommended.
content.location: Approximately 100ft down hill from The George route start.

content.description: Going from the undercling, and setting it up right, is the crux.  I have hit it with either hand but I think the right hand high is best.  The jug is incut and perfect.  How much better does it get?
content.protection: Bolts, all at good spots.  Rap from slings.
content.location: At the end of the Headwall, just before the Icebox dihedral.

content.description: This is a water streak, holds are fairly stable but climb softly anyways.  Pebbles rain down from the top of the Headwall and continue down eventually.  Mostly knobs and edges in the matrix make for good holds.  Stay low in the traverse to the left on the first pitch to keep the bolt above you.  Use a long sling.
content.protection: Many bolts, some 1/2" x 7" with a two bolt anchor first pitch; Rap hangers on left for last pitch.
content.location: To find route, walk south about 200yds along trail at base of Headwall til you come to alcove and shallow dihedral with a line of bolts up a waterstreak.  From Echo Canyon parking lot, look along headwall to tallest portion, a guano-covered pinnacle marks the left side of the climb.

content.description: 8-bolt face climbing up through a bulge (5.7 crux) to a two-bolt chain anchor.  If you know more about this route, please post!
content.location: 15' right of Headwall Route, look for shiny stainless glue-in bolts.

content.description: Four easy routes on the wall allow access to the upper terrace routes.
